name: Minimum Array End
title: Minimum Array End
content:
You are given two integers n and x. You have to construct an array of positive integers nums of size n where for every 0 <= i < n - 1, nums[i + 1] is greater than nums[i], and the result of the bitwise AND operation between all elements of nums is x.

Return the minimum possible value of nums[n - 1].

 

Example 1:

Input: n = 3, x = 4

Output: 6

Explanation:

nums can be [4,5,6] and its last element is 6.

Example 2:

Input: n = 2, x = 7

Output: 15

Explanation:

nums can be [7,15] and its last element is 15.

 

Constraints:

  • 1 <= n, x <= 108

discussion_posts.content: I like it when I figure out the solution without any hints whatsoever, my first submission is accepted and gives a 0 ms run time. It gives me the illusion that I am smrt.

discussion_posts.name: sJQpVnXqyHEg
discussion_posts.content:
the result of the bitwise AND operation between all elements of nums is x

should be the result of the bitwise AND operation "of" all elements of nums is x

Among all elements not between all elements.

discussion_posts.name: coderdayanuj
discussion_posts.content:
My logic is :-
1) Find the binary representation of n-1.   (Let say 1011)
2) Find binary representation of x. (Let say 0000001001)
3) Put the binary representation of n-1 in zeroes of binary representation of x.
Here it will be replaced as :-
_________0000001001  (binary of x)
______________10 _11-  (put binary of n at zeroes of x from right)
_________0000101111    {This in decimal is our required answer}

discussion_posts.content: Suggestion for C++ users, bitset is good for this problem.\nHave a nice day.
